intro: Siphanthera subtilis, commonly known as the delicate thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and purple. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a slightly hairy texture. Siphanthera subtilis is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environments.
